articles.description: MELEKHOVO, Russia (AP) — A Russian court convicted imprisoned opposition leader Alexei Navalny on charges of extremism and sentenced him to 19 years in prison on Friday. Navalny is already serving a nine-year term on a variety of charges that he says were politically motivated.
articles.title: Kremlin critic Navalny convicted of extremism and sentenced to 19 years in prison

articles.author: ALANNA DURKIN RICHER
articles.description: The Justice Department has asked a federal judge overseeing the criminal case against former President Donald Trump in Washington to step in after he released a post online that appeared to promise revenge on anyone who goes after him.
articles.title: Prosecutors ask judge to issue protective order after Trump post appearing to promise revenge

articles.author: WILL GRAVES
articles.description: HOFFMAN ESTATES, Ill. (AP) — Simone Biles spent two years trying to distance herself from those strange days in Tokyo and all the outside noise that came along with it.She dove into theory and slowly — very slowly — returned to training even though she wavered on whether she was really up for a third Olympics and all of the pressure and expectations that come with it when you're considered the greatest of all time.
articles.title: Simone Biles dazzles in her return from a 2-year layoff to dominate the US Classic

articles.author: MICHAEL GOLDBERG
articles.description: JACKSON, Miss. (AP) — Monica Lee sat outside her parents' home, where a former Mississippi sheriff’s deputy pummeled her son, who died hours later in the hospital.It was a sweltering afternoon in Braxton — the same town where, in a separate episode, six white law enforcement officers tortured two other Black men in January, shaking seasoned federal prosecutors, elected officials and ordinary people to their core.
articles.title: Racist abuse by Mississippi officers reveals a culture of misconduct, residents say

articles.author: HANNA ARHIROVA
articles.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Moscow promised retaliation Saturday after Ukrainian drones hit a Russian tanker in the Black Sea near Crimea late Friday, the second sea attack involving drones in one day. Ukraine struck a major Russian port earlier on Friday.
articles.title: Russia promises retaliation after Ukrainian drones hit a Russian tanker in 2nd sea attack in a day

articles.author: KIM TONG-HYUNG
articles.description: SEOUL, South Korea (AP) — North Korean leader Kim Jong Un toured the country’s key weapons factories, including those producing artillery systems and launch vehicles for nuclear-capable ballistic missiles, and pledged to speed up efforts to advance his military’s arms and war readiness, state media said Sunday.
articles.title: North Korean leader Kim tours weapons factories and vows to boost war readiness in face of tensions

articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Police have arrested a 17-year-old high school student on a hate-motivated murder charge in the fatal stabbing of a professional dancer during an altercation between two groups of friends at a New York City gas station last weekend.
articles.title: New York City high school student charged with hate-motivated murder in killing of gay dancer

articles.author: JIM GOMEZ
articles.description: MANILA, Philippines (AP) — The Philippine military condemned on Sunday a Chinese coast guard ship's “excessive and offensive” use of a water cannon to block a Filipino supply boat from delivering new troops, food, water and fuel to a Philippine-occupied shoal in the disputed South China Sea.
articles.title: Philippine military condemns Chinese coast guard's use of water cannon on its boat in disputed sea

articles.author: NICOLE WINFIELD, BARRY HATTON and PIETRO DE CRISTOFARO
articles.description: LISBON, Portugal (AP) — An estimated 1.5 million young people filled a field in the Portuguese capital Lisbon on Saturday for Pope Francis’ World Youth Day vigil, braving scorching heat to secure a spot for the evening prayer and to camp out overnight for his final farewell Mass on Sunday morning.
articles.title: Pilgrims brave scorching heat for pope's vigil in Lisbon after Francis ditches Fatima peace prayer

articles.author: RIAZAT BUTT
articles.description: ISLAMABAD (AP) — Pakistan’s former Prime Minister Imran Khan was arrested Saturday after a court handed him a three-year jail sentence for corruption, a development that could end his future in politics.
articles.title: Pakistan's former Prime Minister Imran Khan handed 3-year sentence and moved to high-security prison
